job_description: Contract Business Analyst - job post Eversheds Sutherland 39 reviews Austin, TX 78701 $40 - $80 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $40 - $80 an hour Job Type Contract We have an exciting opportunity for a Contract Business Analyst at Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP. We are searching for someone who wants to be a valued contributor and member of a talented and dynamic team of lawyers, paralegals and staff. The Contract Business Analyst is responsible for the requirements from elicitation to implementation ensuring the end solution meets the business needs. The Contract Business Analyst works closely with internal customers and IT teams to define, manage and document requirements for several concurrent initiatives. Responsibilities and Duties: Gathers, understands, analyzes, and documents the need of project stakeholders, formalizing the needs into a set of actionable business requirements. Analyzes, evaluates, and documents the current business processes and identifies future state, including business process modeling. Leads and completes vendor and software selection assessment, as needed. Schedules, plans, and leads requirement gathering and review meetings. Documents and communicates key decisions and actions items. Partners on development and implementation of standard business analysis tools and methodologies with BA team and PMO Manager. Monitors cross-functional deliverables ensuring timely completion of requirement analysis and solution design. Supports change management. Researches and reviews up-to-date business processes and new IT advancements to make systems more modern. Engages with stakeholders at all levels. Performs user acceptance testing. Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations to project sponsors and team members. Clearly communicates project issues and proposed mitigations to stakeholders and management. Collaborates with project managers and cross-functional teams throughout the project implementation cycle, as needed. Manages competing resources and priorities. Coordinates the day-to-day operational aspects of an initiative with PMO Manager. Applies and understands the full analysis process: Defining scope Identifying project benefits Developing business cases Requirements elicitation and management Process optimisation Business change management Requirements tractability to business benefits Input into testing Facilitating user acceptance testing Benefits realization Other duties as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: A Bachelor’s degree is required in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field, from an accredited college or university or an equivalent combination of an Associate degree with related job experience. Required Certifications: Industry recognized Business Analyst Certification (CAP or PBA or IIBA etc.) or Project Management Certification (PMP, SCM etc.) Five-seven years of experience working in a Technology Department is required, with a preference given for work experience in a multi-office legal environment. A minimum of five years of experience in leading projects as a business analyst. Familiar with software development methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills are required. Detail-oriented and organized. Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads. Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language. Strong problem solving and decision-making skills. Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Office Suite with proficiency in Outlook are required. Salary is commensurate with years of experience and geographic location. The hourly rate for this position will be $40-80/hr. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within our Firm and in the larger legal profession. We believe that diverse skills, knowledge and viewpoints make us a stronger firm. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP maintains a policy of affording all employees and applicants equal employment opportunities without regard to actual or perceived race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or expression or transgender status), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or familial status, domestic violence victim status, ancestry, amnesty, citizenship status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Unlawful discrimination, harassment and retaliation will not be tolerated in any of the Firm’s offices or any other work-related setting. Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for a position or to enable them to perform the essential functions of a position for which they are otherwise qualified. EEO. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Cloud Solutions Architect - job post Dutech Dutech in Austin, TX 78701 $70 - $80 an hour -  Contract Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 11 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $70 - $80 an hour Job Type Contract The Office of the Attorney General of Texas requires the services of 1 Solutions Architect Specialist, hereafter referred to as Candidate, who meets the general qualifications of Solutions Architect 2 and the specifications outlined in this document. Responsible for executing design thinking sessions, conducting client interviews, collecting business requirements, user journey mapping. Conducts secondary research, soliciting guidance from account teams and industry specialists, and working with technical specialists and product managers. Uses agile methodologies to analyze business and customer service requirements and designs service solutions to meet those objectives. Be the primary expert to design the specific solution, scope document, risk profile, and corresponding analytics to meet targeted outcomes. Maintains and utilizes detailed industry and internal services knowledge in the construction of industry-leading services solutions, including knowledge of the processes, technologies, security, and people components involved in the services arena. Develops a strategy for creating iterative prototypes and proof of concept and works with stakeholders to implement it. Participates in the construction of detailed analytics models that align with complex services proposals. Composes Statement of Work or other documents, using departmental automation tools as available, to craft detailed and accurate deliverables that specify processes, technology, security, staffing, and project management involved in proposed services solutions. As needed, provide a "trusted expert advisor" role as a Subject Matter Expert for technical services to both internal and external customers, ranging from formal advice to internal and external customer presentations. Follow all organizational Standard Operating Procedures relative to cost modeling, approvals and reviews, and all other associated workflow and deliverables. Key Responsibilities: · Solutions Architecture · Lean Process Management · Agile Process Mining · Agile Customer Journey Mapping · Agile Target State Solutioning in Bodying MVP Principle · Preparing proposals and estimates for the design and implementation of IT systems · Completing IT assignments on time · Monitoring the work of others during the project completion · Using corrective measures when the project plan is off course · Helping managerial staff develop policies and guidelines · Synchronizing business needs with IT systems · Evaluating technologies and propose recommendations aligned to standards · Creating designs that conform to the reference architecture and adhere to the agency's standards, including meeting security compliance requirements · Implementing prototypes and testing software programs II. CANDIDATE SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Requirements: Candidates that do not meet or exceed the minimum stated requirements (skills/experience) will be displayed to customers but may not be chosen for this opportunity. Years Required/Preferred Experience 4 Required Ability to communicate and work seamlessly in a virtual/remote environment. Strong business acumen and a collaborative, influential partner able to educate, build relationships, and foster adoption of sound security practices (commitment + compliance) 4 Required Strong experience with project/issue tracking systems such as JIRA 4 Required Ability to meet deadlines, clear blockers, communicate delays and clarify ambiguous requirements. 4 Required Ability to resolve complex projectized issues in diverse and decentralized environments; to learn, communicate, and manage technical projects; and to communicate effectively. 4 Required Excellent communication and organizational skills, and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace. 4 Required Extensive skill in effective verbal and written communications with other computer professionals, clients, and vendors. 4 Required Experience with progressive broad-based information systems, system integration and project delivery experience. 4 Required Ability to analyze and problem solve. Has worked under limited supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. 4 Required Ability to establish and always maintain effective and professional working relationships with others in the course and scope of conducting business 4 Required Architecture experience, preferably at least 50% of which is in an agile environment. 4 Required Record of accomplishment of building relationships and collaborating cross-functionally. 4 Required Record of defining and adopting standardized solution architecture practices 4 Required Experience building key performance indicators, key risk indicators and operational metrics and presenting to various levels of management 4 Required Hands-on Application/API/Services Development and System/Business Analyst experience 4 Required Data development, analytics development, data administration, API development, or data science experience 4 Required Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in information technology security, computer information systems, computer science, management information systems, or a related field is generally preferred. 5 Preferred Design and implementation of complex analytics systems 4 Preferred Technology Leadership Experience 2 Preferred Knowledge of DevOps concepts, tools, and systems Job Type: Contract Salary: $70.00 - $80.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Austin, TX 78701: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Application Question(s): Required two professional references for the Interview - Application Developer - Remote -- 12+ month contract - job post Locks Global Staffing LLC Austin, TX 78701 • Remote $60 - $80 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $60 - $80 an hour Job Type Contract The ideal candidate will have spent their most recent 3 years working in a Application Developer role on a variety of platforms where you were responsible for; Troubleshooting and resolving user application issues – such as; platform operability, data integrations, ETL, environment management, license configuration/assignment, security, single sign on, global dashboards, custom report configuration, data modelling, field creation, page layouts, validation rules, workflows, system batch processes, API’s, user management, notifications and email templates Communicating with business partners, process owners and subject matter experts to identify root causes of application issues Informing support requestors of the status and expected resolution time of open issues Escalating issues to appropriate IT teams and monitoring progress Interacting with Vendor’s (ISV) and assisting with diagnosis of non-customer owned platforms Assisting user SME’s with identifying work arounds Application maintenance and configuration Assisting with the “Top 10” trends of issues and outline improvement opportunities per quarter Participated in triage and analysis of incoming user issues Prioritized issues based on business impact, risk, architectural significance, and other factors Conducted team reviews of common issues and recommended resolution paths to include; technical bug-fixes, training reinforcement, IT escalations and documentation Ensure the teams work efforts align with business goals Manage customer/user expectations Applied best practices to support triage and user communication Collaborate with Product Owner(s) and Project Manager to complete Iteration and release planning, ensuring appropriate technical representation Supporting business process questions from end users Support and configuration activities Documenting application features Qualifications Bachelor's degree in CS, MIS, technical area or the equivalent combination of education and experience Preferred 3 years’ Salesforce experience in medium to large corporate environment Preferred 3+ years’ experience in administration and configuration of multiple cloud/server products Preferred Ability to exercise good judgment, decision making and creativity Ability to readily grasp complex architectural environments Ability to work from general direction in the development of detailed solutions. Must enjoy assisting others in supporting project needs Demonstrated analytical capabilities including complex technical problem solving, effective communication and organizational skills Experience in all phases of software development life cycle methodologies and processes. Demonstrated work performance in a high-performance self-directed team environment Ability to follow and adhere to standards and methodologies Experience in any of the following areas is a plus: Salesforce Service Cloud and Sales Cloud Implementations Performing business analysis for IT projects and/ or Agile experience Background with salesforce.com reporting tools If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
